records.location_details: Migrants were allegedly transported by Albanian authorities to a location near BCP Kakavia on the Albanian side and instructed to cross into Greece. The incident occurred at the Albanian-Greek border, specifically around the Kakavia Border Crossing Point.
records.where_clear: Kakavia Border Crossing Point, Albania/Greece border

possible_violations.legal_basis: Art. 4 of Protocol no. 4 of the European Convention on Human Rights

possible_violations.violation_name: prohibition of inhuman or degrading treatment
possible_violations.legal_basis: Article 3 of the European Convention on Human Rights

records.context_note: Migrants claimed they were apprehended by Albanian authorities 20 km from Tirana, brought to a police station near Kakavia, and then transported to a location near BCP Kakavia on 02.03.2022. They were allegedly shown a path to cross into Greece and released. They reached the Greek side of the BCP on 03.03.2022. Frontex could not establish if a fundamental rights violation occurred due to limited information, but noted consistency with other similar allegations.
records.evidence_quote: Interviewed migrants claim to have been apprehended, brought to a police station and later transported to a place near BCP Kakavia by the Albanian police where they were shown to follow a path to cross to Greece territory.
